CodeplexIssue.Title: No COM Addin example runs under W8/Office 2013
CodeplexIssue.DescriptionHtml: I tried to run any outlook COM Add-in under W8 and Office 2013, but neither works. The addins registered successfully and they are visible in the COM Add-In dialog, but all time disabled. Trying to load the Add-In manually produces a message, which states, that " ... is not a valid Office Add-In."

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
please let me know more about the machine and the office version.windows is 64bit?office is 32bit?your addin use .net 4.5 ?fusion log viewer say, no missing dependencies?vb or c# solution?its works fine in w7(same bitness scenario)?
*sebastian

CodeplexComment.Author: RogerLae
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Windows is 8 Pro 64, Office 2013 32 bit (15.0.4551.1007), tried all C# addins 4.0 and 4.5, any CPU, x86 and x64 without success; found out, that's not a NetOffice - problem. Following step by step the instruction under http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/ff868772.aspx leads to the same. Fusion Log viewer keeps still for any scenario RogerLae

CodeplexComment.Author: allquixotic
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
I am having the exact same problem as OP.
I am running Windows 8.1 64-bit with Office 2013 and 2010 64-bit installed on the machine.
I tried my own extension, which loads on Windows 7 32-bit with Office 2010, but I recompiled it targeting x86-64, and the same behavior occurs, as when I target NetOffice 1.7.0 (Preview)\NET 4.0\Examples\Word\C#\NetOffice COMAddin Examples\Extended\bin\Debug\NetOfficeTools.ExtendedWordCS4.dll
I do manual regasm with /codebase with admin privileges to make sure it registers, and the registry keys look OK, but the "Location" in the MS Word Add-in list is empty for these NetOffice addins.
I am able to load addins developed with Visual Studio 2013 and VSTO just fine.
I tried both Office 2010 and Office 2013 to see if they were any different -- nope, neither one will load any NetOffice addins, even if they are compiled for 64-bit and bundled with all dependencies. In fact I used the same MSI (compiled with WiX) to install my addin that runs fine on Windows 7 32-bit, and still no go.
Looks like NetOffice is simply broken on Windows 8 / 8.1 64-bit with Office 2013 installed, even if Office 2013 is 32-bit or 64-bit, even if you have a parallel install of Office 2010. :(

CodeplexComment.Author: allquixotic
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Addendum: I can reproduce the problem on both NetOffice 1.6.0, and NetOffice 1.7.0 Preview.

CodeplexComment.Author: RogerLae
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: As I stated in my comment 13.1. this is not a problem of NetOffice. Reproducing the steps of MS - tutorial under http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/ff868772.aspx leads to the same result.

CodeplexComment.Author: allquixotic
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Then we are experiencing different issues, since VSTO works for me.

CodeplexComment.Author: RogerLae
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: This is not the tutorial for using VSTO (may be it works), but for COMAddins via IDTExtensibility2 Interface (the same technique, which use Sebastian)
